_template_info._comment: COMPREHENSIVE HOMODYNE CONFIGURATION TEMPLATE - Based on current codebase v1.0.0
_template_info._based_on_analysis: All existing config files (static_isotropic, static_anisotropic, laminar_flow) merged with recent enhancements
_template_info._usage: Copy this template and customize the analysis_mode, initial_parameters, and experimental_data sections for your specific experiment

_config_modes.static_isotropic: 3-parameter optimization [D0, alpha, D_offset] - no angle filtering
_config_modes.static_anisotropic: 3-parameter optimization [D0, alpha, D_offset] - with angle filtering
_config_modes.laminar_flow: 7-parameter optimization [D0, alpha, D_offset, gamma0, beta, gamma_offset, phi0] - full flow dynamics

metadata._comment: Template metadata - Customize description and analysis_mode for your experiment
metadata.description: TEMPLATE: Comprehensive homodyne scattering analysis configuration
metadata.based_on: He et al. PNAS 2024 - Transport coefficient approach

plotting_features.multi_method_support: Separate plots generated for each optimization method (Nelder-Mead, Gurobi, etc.)

metadata.parameters_optimized: DEPENDS_ON_MODE: [D0,alpha,D_offset] for static modes, [D0,alpha,D_offset,gamma0,beta,gamma_offset,phi0] for laminar_flow
metadata.script_compatibility: homodyne v1.0.0 with enhanced Gurobi optimization and code quality improvements

experimental_data._comment: CUSTOMIZE: Update paths and filenames for your experimental data

analyzer_parameters._comment: CUSTOMIZE: Core physics parameters for your experiment

temporal._dt_note: Time step between frames in seconds - CUSTOMIZE for your acquisition
temporal._start_frame_note: CUSTOMIZE: Skip initial frames for equilibration

geometry._gap_note: CUSTOMIZE: Gap in Angstroms - critical for laminar_flow, less important for static modes

computational._max_threads_note: Increased from 8 to 16 for large dataset optimization
computational._memory_limit_note: Optimized for large datasets - adaptive memory management

initial_parameters._comment: CUSTOMIZE: Starting values - CRITICAL for convergence. Adjust based on your analysis_mode
initial_parameters._mode_dependent_note: Parameter count depends on analysis_mode: 3 for static modes, 7 for laminar_flow

_laminar_flow_additional.beta: Power-law exponent for shear rate evolution
_laminar_flow_additional.phi0: Angular offset between flow and scattering

initial_parameters.parameter_units: MODE_DEPENDENT: Matches units above in dict format

optimization_config._comment: Comprehensive optimization settings with enhanced Gurobi and robust methods

angle_filtering._mode_dependent: disabled for static_isotropic, enabled for static_anisotropic and laminar_flow
angle_filtering.enabled: MODE_DEPENDENT: false for static_isotropic, true for others

classical_optimization._methods_note: Classical methods always available. Robust methods in separate section below.

_method_flags.--method classical: Runs ONLY classical methods: Nelder-Mead, Gurobi (if licensed)
_method_flags.--method robust: Runs ONLY robust methods: Robust-Wasserstein, Robust-Scenario, Robust-Ellipsoidal
_method_flags.--method all: Runs classical + robust optimization for comprehensive analysis

classical_optimization._gurobi_availability: Requires Gurobi license (pip install gurobipy). Now uses enhanced Trust Region SQP.

Nelder-Mead._maxiter_note: Optimized for large datasets (0.1M-4M datapoints) - increased from original for better convergence

Gurobi._comment: ENHANCED: Now uses iterative Trust Region SQP instead of single-shot QP (fixes χ² convergence)
Gurobi._algorithm: Iterative trust region SQP optimization with quadratic approximation and adaptive radius
Gurobi._max_iterations_note: Optimized for large datasets - increased for better convergence
Gurobi._tolerance_note: Convergence tolerance for trust region updates
Gurobi._method_note: Gurobi solver method (2=barrier recommended for QP subproblems)
Gurobi._time_limit_note: Extended time limit for large datasets (0.1M-4M datapoints)

_trust_region_settings._note: Trust region hyperparameters for enhanced optimization

Gurobi._advantages: Better convergence than old single-shot QP, handles bounds naturally
Gurobi._requirements: Gurobi license required for enhanced optimization performance

classical_optimization._selection_strategy_note: best_chi_squared, consensus, or first_success when multiple methods used

subsampling._comment: Subsampling configuration for large datasets to improve optimization performance
subsampling._enabled_note: Enable subsampling for datasets exceeding max_data_points. Set to false only for small datasets (<100k points) or when full data fidelity is critical.
subsampling._max_data_points_note: Maximum data points before subsampling kicks in. For 2000x2000 dataset with 2 angles = 8M points, subsampling is highly recommended.
subsampling._time_subsample_note: Subsample every Nth time point (4 = keep 1 in 4 points). Reduces 2000 frames → 500 frames.
subsampling._angle_subsample_note: Subsample every Nth angle (2 = keep 1 in 2 angles). Note: angle subsampling is automatically skipped when n_angles < 4 to preserve angular information for anisotropic analysis.
subsampling._expected_reduction: With factors (4, 2): 8M points → ~250k points (32x reduction). Additional reduction applied if still too large.
subsampling._performance_impact: Typical speedup: 20-50x faster optimization with minimal χ² degradation (<10%)
subsampling._when_to_disable: Only disable for small datasets (<100k points) or when you need full resolution for publication-quality fits

robust_optimization._comment: ENHANCED: 100x-5000x performance improvements with caching and optimized solvers
robust_optimization._performance_upgrades: v1.0.0+ optimizations: adaptive Jacobians, CLARABEL/SCS solvers, smart caching
_usage_examples: python run_homodyne.py --method robust  # Run only robust methods
python run_homodyne.py --method classical  # Include robust in classical analysis
python run_homodyne.py --method all  # Comprehensive: classical + robust
robust_optimization._uncertainty_radius_note: Fraction of data variance for uncertainty set
robust_optimization._regularization_alpha_note: L2 regularization - higher for complex parameter spaces
robust_optimization._jacobian_epsilon_note: Finite difference step for adaptive Jacobians
robust_optimization._enable_caching_note: Smart caching provides major performance gains
robust_optimization._preferred_solver_note: Optimized CVXPY solver: CLARABEL > SCS > CVXOPT

scaling_parameters._comment: Physical scaling: c2_fitted = c2_theory * contrast + offset

parameter_space._comment: CUSTOMIZE: Parameter bounds and priors - adjust based on your physical system
parameter_space._bounds_note: Parameter bounds depend on analysis_mode - see mode-specific examples below

bounds.name: D0
bounds._customize_note: Adjust D0 bounds based on your expected diffusion rates

bounds.name: alpha
bounds._customize_note: Power-law exponent - typically [-2, 2] range is sufficient

bounds.name: D_offset
bounds._customize_note: Baseline diffusion - adjust based on system

bounds.name: gamma0
bounds._customize_note: Reference shear rate - adjust for your flow conditions

bounds.name: phi0
bounds._customize_note: Angular offset - adjust based on geometry

analysis_settings._comment: CUSTOMIZE: Set analysis_mode and corresponding static_mode/static_submode
analysis_settings.static_mode: MODE_DEPENDENT: true for static_isotropic/static_anisotropic, false for laminar_flow
analysis_settings._static_mode_note: Controls whether to use static (3-param) or dynamic (7-param) model
analysis_settings.static_submode: MODE_DEPENDENT: isotropic/anisotropic for static modes, null for laminar_flow
analysis_settings._submode_note: Isotropic disables angle filtering, anisotropic enables it

model_description.laminar_flow: g₂ = g₁_diff × g₁_shear with sinc² term for full flow dynamics

chi_squared_calculation._scaling_note: Scaling optimization always enabled for proper chi-squared calculation

validity_check.check_positive_gamma0: MODE_DEPENDENT: false for static modes, true for laminar_flow

optimization_controls._max_function_evaluations_note: Higher limits for complex parameter spaces

performance_settings._comment: Performance optimization settings with mode-dependent scaling

performance_monitoring._optimization_note: Enhanced monitoring for large dataset optimization

noise_model._note: False uses full forward model consistent with classical optimization

fit_quality._comment: Chi-squared quality thresholds - adjust based on your data quality expectations

output_settings._output_structure: homodyne_analysis_results.json (main summary) saved to output directory root. Method-specific results in subdirectories: classical/[method_name]/ and robust/[method_name]/ containing analysis_results_[method_name].json, parameters.json, fitted_data.npz (c2_experimental, c2_fitted, residuals, parameters, uncertainties, chi_squared, phi_angles, t1, t2), and c2_heatmaps_[method_name].png. Summary files: all_classical_methods_summary.json, all_robust_methods_summary.json.

plotting._comment: Comprehensive plotting configuration with method-specific outputs

general._figsize_note: Larger figures for complex parameter results

c2_heatmaps._method_specific_note: Separate heatmaps generated for each optimization method (Nelder-Mead, Gurobi, Robust-*, etc.) with method names in filenames
c2_heatmaps.figsize: MODE_DEPENDENT: [12,4] for static_isotropic, [15,5] for static_anisotropic, [18,6] for laminar_flow

output._filename_template_note: Frame-aware plotting with method identification: start_frame, end_frame for data range, method name (Nelder-Mead, Gurobi-Iterative-QP, Robust-Wasserstein, etc.), timestamp

_customization_guide._step_1: Set analysis_mode in metadata section to: static_isotropic, static_anisotropic, or laminar_flow
_customization_guide._step_2: Update experimental_data section with your file paths and sample name
_customization_guide._step_3: Customize analyzer_parameters: dt (time step), q (wavevector), frame range, gap size
_customization_guide._step_4: Adjust initial_parameters values based on your expected parameter ranges
_customization_guide._step_5: Modify parameter_space bounds to match your physical system constraints
_customization_guide._step_6: Update analysis_settings: set static_mode and static_submode consistently with analysis_mode
_customization_guide._step_7: Adjust performance_settings based on your computational resources
_customization_guide._step_8: Customize validation_rules thresholds based on your data quality expectations
_customization_guide._step_9: Update output_settings paths and logging configuration
_customization_guide._mode_dependent_values: Search for 'MODE_DEPENDENT' throughout config to see values that need mode-specific customization
